6564 /**
6565  * sys_sched_get_priority_min - return minimum RT priority.
6566  * @policy: scheduling class.
6567  *
6568  * Return: On success, this syscall returns the minimum
6569  * rt_priority that can be used by a given scheduling class.
6570  * On failure, a negative error code is returned.
6571  */
6572 SYSCALL_DEFINE1(sched_get_priority_min, int, policy)
6573 {
6574         int ret = -EINVAL;
6575 
6576         switch (policy) {
6577         case SCHED_FIFO:
6578         case SCHED_RR:
6579                 ret = 1;
6580                 break;
6581         case SCHED_DEADLINE:
6582         case SCHED_NORMAL:
6583         case SCHED_BATCH:
6584         case SCHED_IDLE:
6585                 ret = 0;
6586         }
6587         return ret;
6588 }
6589 
6590 static int sched_rr_get_interval(pid_t pid, struct timespec64 *t)
6591 {
6592         struct task_struct *p;
6593         unsigned int time_slice;
6594         struct rq_flags rf;
6595         struct rq *rq;
6596         int retval;
6597 
6598         if (pid < 0)
6599                 return -EINVAL;
6600 
6601         retval = -ESRCH;
6602         rcu_read_lock();
6603         p = find_process_by_pid(pid);
6604         if (!p)
6605                 goto out_unlock;
6606 
6607         retval = security_task_getscheduler(p);
6608         if (retval)
6609                 goto out_unlock;
6610 
6611         rq = task_rq_lock(p, &rf);
6612         time_slice = 0;
6613         if (p->sched_class->get_rr_interval)
6614                 time_slice = p->sched_class->get_rr_interval(rq, p);
6615         task_rq_unlock(rq, p, &rf);
6616 
6617         rcu_read_unlock();
6618         jiffies_to_timespec64(time_slice, t);
6619         return 0;
6620 
6621 out_unlock:
6622         rcu_read_unlock();
6623         return retval;
6624 }
6625 
6626 /**
6627  * sys_sched_rr_get_interval - return the default timeslice of a process.
6628  * @pid: pid of the process.
6629  * @interval: userspace pointer to the timeslice value.
6630  *
6631  * this syscall writes the default timeslice value of a given process
6632  * into the user-space timespec buffer. A value of '0' means infinity.
6633  *
6634  * Return: On success, 0 and the timeslice is in @interval. Otherwise,
6635  * an error code.
6636  */
6637 SYSCALL_DEFINE2(sched_rr_get_interval, pid_t, pid,
6638                 struct __kernel_timespec __user *, interval)
6639 {
6640         struct timespec64 t;
6641         int retval = sched_rr_get_interval(pid, &t);
6642 
6643         if (retval == 0)
6644                 retval = put_timespec64(&t, interval);
6645 
6646         return retval;
6647 }
6648 
6649 #ifdef CONFIG_COMPAT_32BIT_TIME
6650 SYSCALL_DEFINE2(sched_rr_get_interval_time32, pid_t, pid,
6651                 struct old_timespec32 __user *, interval)
6652 {
6653         struct timespec64 t;
6654         int retval = sched_rr_get_interval(pid, &t);
6655 
6656         if (retval == 0)
6657                 retval = put_old_timespec32(&t, interval);
6658         return retval;
6659 }
6660 #endif
6661 
6662 void sched_show_task(struct task_struct *p)
6663 {
6664         unsigned long free = 0;
6665         int ppid;
6666 
6667         if (!try_get_task_stack(p))
6668                 return;
6669 
6670         pr_info("task:%-15.15s state:%c", p->comm, task_state_to_char(p));
6671 
6672         if (p->state == TASK_RUNNING)
6673                 pr_cont("  running task    ");
6674 #ifdef CONFIG_DEBUG_STACK_USAGE
6675         free = stack_not_used(p);
6676 #endif
6677         ppid = 0;
6678         rcu_read_lock();
6679         if (pid_alive(p))
6680                 ppid = task_pid_nr(rcu_dereference(p->real_parent));
6681         rcu_read_unlock();
6682         pr_cont(" stack:%5lu pid:%5d ppid:%6d flags:0x%08lx\n",
6683                 free, task_pid_nr(p), ppid,
6684                 (unsigned long)task_thread_info(p)->flags);
6685 
6686         print_worker_info(KERN_INFO, p);
6687         trace_android_vh_sched_show_task(p);
6688         show_stack(p, NULL, KERN_INFO);
6689         put_task_stack(p);
6690 }
6691 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(sched_show_task);
6692 
6693 static inline bool
6694 state_filter_match(unsigned long state_filter, struct task_struct *p)
6695 {
6696         /* no filter, everything matches */
6697         if (!state_filter)
6698                 return true;
6699 
6700         /* filter, but doesn't match */
6701         if (!(p->state & state_filter))
6702                 return false;
6703 
6704         /*
6705          * When looking for TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE skip TASK_IDLE (allows
6706          * TASK_KILLABLE).
6707          */
6708         if (state_filter == TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE && p->state == TASK_IDLE)
6709                 return false;
6710 
6711         return true;
6712 }
6713 
6714 
6715 void show_state_filter(unsigned long state_filter)
6716 {
6717         struct task_struct *g, *p;
6718 
6719         rcu_read_lock();
6720         for_each_process_thread(g, p) {
6721                 /*
6722                  * reset the NMI-timeout, listing all files on a slow
6723                  * console might take a lot of time:
6724                  * Also, reset softlockup watchdogs on all CPUs, because
6725                  * another CPU might be blocked waiting for us to process
6726                  * an IPI.
6727                  */
6728                 touch_nmi_watchdog();
6729                 touch_all_softlockup_watchdogs();
6730                 if (state_filter_match(state_filter, p))
6731                         sched_show_task(p);
6732         }
6733 
6734 #ifdef CONFIG_SCHED_DEBUG
6735         if (!state_filter)
6736                 sysrq_sched_debug_show();
6737 #endif
6738         rcu_read_unlock();
6739         /*
6740          * Only show locks if all tasks are dumped:
6741          */
6742         if (!state_filter)
6743                 debug_show_all_locks();
6744 }
6745 
6746 /**
6747  * init_idle - set up an idle thread for a given CPU
6748  * @idle: task in question
6749  * @cpu: CPU the idle task belongs to
6750  *
6751  * NOTE: this function does not set the idle thread's NEED_RESCHED
6752  * flag, to make booting more robust.
6753  */
6754 void init_idle(struct task_struct *idle, int cpu)
6755 {
6756         struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(cpu);
6757         unsigned long flags;
6758 
6759         __sched_fork(0, idle);
6760 
6761         raw_spin_lock_irqsave(&idle->pi_lock, flags);
6762         raw_spin_lock(&rq->lock);
6763 
6764         idle->state = TASK_RUNNING;
6765         idle->se.exec_start = sched_clock();
6766         idle->flags |= PF_IDLE;
6767 
6768         scs_task_reset(idle);
6769         kasan_unpoison_task_stack(idle);
6770 
6771 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
6772         /*
6773          * Its possible that init_idle() gets called multiple times on a task,
6774          * in that case do_set_cpus_allowed() will not do the right thing.
6775          *
6776          * And since this is boot we can forgo the serialization.
6777          */
6778         set_cpus_allowed_common(idle, cpumask_of(cpu));
6779 #endif
6780         /*
6781          * We're having a chicken and egg problem, even though we are
6782          * holding rq->lock, the CPU isn't yet set to this CPU so the
6783          * lockdep check in task_group() will fail.
6784          *
6785          * Similar case to sched_fork(). / Alternatively we could
6786          * use task_rq_lock() here and obtain the other rq->lock.
6787          *
6788          * Silence PROVE_RCU
6789          */
6790         rcu_read_lock();
6791         __set_task_cpu(idle, cpu);
6792         rcu_read_unlock();
6793 
6794         rq->idle = idle;
6795         rcu_assign_pointer(rq->curr, idle);
6796         idle->on_rq = TASK_ON_RQ_QUEUED;
6797 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
6798         idle->on_cpu = 1;
6799 #endif
6800         raw_spin_unlock(&rq->lock);
6801         raw_spin_unlock_irqrestore(&idle->pi_lock, flags);
6802 
6803         /* Set the preempt count _outside_ the spinlocks! */
6804         init_idle_preempt_count(idle, cpu);
6805 
6806         /*
6807          * The idle tasks have their own, simple scheduling class:
6808          */
6809         idle->sched_class = &idle_sched_class;
6810         ftrace_graph_init_idle_task(idle, cpu);
6811         vtime_init_idle(idle, cpu);
6812 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
6813         sprintf(idle->comm, "%s/%d", INIT_TASK_COMM, cpu);
6814 #endif
6815 }
6816 
6817 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
6818 
6819 int cpuset_cpumask_can_shrink(const struct cpumask *cur,
6820                               const struct cpumask *trial)
6821 {
6822         int ret = 1;
6823 
6824         if (!cpumask_weight(cur))
6825                 return ret;
6826 
6827         ret = dl_cpuset_cpumask_can_shrink(cur, trial);
6828 
6829         return ret;
6830 }
6831 
6832 int task_can_attach(struct task_struct *p,
6833                     const struct cpumask *cs_cpus_allowed)
6834 {
6835         int ret = 0;
6836 
6837         /*
6838          * Kthreads which disallow setaffinity shouldn't be moved
6839          * to a new cpuset; we don't want to change their CPU
6840          * affinity and isolating such threads by their set of
6841          * allowed nodes is unnecessary.  Thus, cpusets are not
6842          * applicable for such threads.  This prevents checking for
6843          * success of set_cpus_allowed_ptr() on all attached tasks
6844          * before cpus_mask may be changed.
6845          */
6846         if (p->flags & PF_NO_SETAFFINITY) {
6847                 ret = -EINVAL;
6848                 goto out;
6849         }
6850 
6851         if (dl_task(p) && !cpumask_intersects(task_rq(p)->rd->span,
6852                                               cs_cpus_allowed))
6853                 ret = dl_task_can_attach(p, cs_cpus_allowed);
6854 
6855 out:
6856         return ret;
6857 }
6858 
6859 bool sched_smp_initialized __read_mostly;
6860 
6861 #ifdef CONFIG_NUMA_BALANCING
6862 /* Migrate current task p to target_cpu */
6863 int migrate_task_to(struct task_struct *p, int target_cpu)
6864 {
6865         struct migration_arg arg = { p, target_cpu };
6866         int curr_cpu = task_cpu(p);
6867 
6868         if (curr_cpu == target_cpu)
6869                 return 0;
6870 
6871         if (!cpumask_test_cpu(target_cpu, p->cpus_ptr))
6872                 return -EINVAL;
6873 
6874         /* TODO: This is not properly updating schedstats */
6875 
6876         trace_sched_move_numa(p, curr_cpu, target_cpu);
6877         return stop_one_cpu(curr_cpu, migration_cpu_stop, &arg);
6878 }
6879 
6880 /*
6881  * Requeue a task on a given node and accurately track the number of NUMA
6882  * tasks on the runqueues
6883  */
6884 void sched_setnuma(struct task_struct *p, int nid)
6885 {
6886         bool queued, running;
6887         struct rq_flags rf;
6888         struct rq *rq;
6889 
6890         rq = task_rq_lock(p, &rf);
6891         queued = task_on_rq_queued(p);
6892         running = task_current(rq, p);
6893 
6894         if (queued)
6895                 dequeue_task(rq, p, DEQUEUE_SAVE);
6896         if (running)
6897                 put_prev_task(rq, p);
6898 
6899         p->numa_preferred_nid = nid;
6900 
6901         if (queued)
6902                 enqueue_task(rq, p, ENQUEUE_RESTORE | ENQUEUE_NOCLOCK);
6903         if (running)
6904                 set_next_task(rq, p);
6905         task_rq_unlock(rq, p, &rf);
6906 }
6907 #endif /* CONFIG_NUMA_BALANCING */
6908 
6909 #ifdef CONFIG_HOTPLUG_CPU
6910 /*
6911  * Ensure that the idle task is using init_mm right before its CPU goes
6912  * offline.
6913  */
6914 void idle_task_exit(void)
6915 {
6916         struct mm_struct *mm = current->active_mm;
6917 
6918         BUG_ON(cpu_online(smp_processor_id()));
6919         BUG_ON(current != this_rq()->idle);
6920 
6921         if (mm != &init_mm) {
6922                 switch_mm(mm, &init_mm, current);
6923                 finish_arch_post_lock_switch();
6924         }
6925 
6926         /* finish_cpu(), as ran on the BP, will clean up the active_mm state */
6927 }
6928 
6929 /*
6930  * Since this CPU is going 'away' for a while, fold any nr_active delta
6931  * we might have. Assumes we're called after migrate_tasks() so that the
6932  * nr_active count is stable. We need to take the teardown thread which
6933  * is calling this into account, so we hand in adjust = 1 to the load
6934  * calculation.
6935  *
6936  * Also see the comment "Global load-average calculations".
6937  */
6938 static void calc_load_migrate(struct rq *rq)
6939 {
6940         long delta = calc_load_fold_active(rq, 1);
6941         if (delta)
6942                 atomic_long_add(delta, &calc_load_tasks);
6943 }
6944 
6945 static struct task_struct *__pick_migrate_task(struct rq *rq)
6946 {
6947         const struct sched_class *class;
6948         struct task_struct *next;
6949 
6950         for_each_class(class) {
6951                 next = class->pick_next_task(rq);
6952                 if (next) {
6953                         next->sched_class->put_prev_task(rq, next);
6954                         return next;
6955                 }
6956         }
6957 
6958         /* The idle class should always have a runnable task */
6959         BUG();
6960 }
6961 
6962 /*
6963  * Migrate all tasks from the rq, sleeping tasks will be migrated by
6964  * try_to_wake_up()->select_task_rq().
6965  *
6966  * Called with rq->lock held even though we'er in stop_machine() and
6967  * there's no concurrency possible, we hold the required locks anyway
6968  * because of lock validation efforts.
6969  *
6970  * force: if false, the function will skip CPU pinned kthreads.
6971  */
6972 static void migrate_tasks(struct rq *dead_rq, struct rq_flags *rf, bool force)
6973 {
6974         struct rq *rq = dead_rq;
6975         struct task_struct *next, *tmp, *stop = rq->stop;
6976         LIST_HEAD(percpu_kthreads);
6977         struct rq_flags orf = *rf;
6978         int dest_cpu;
6979 
6980         /*
6981          * Fudge the rq selection such that the below task selection loop
6982          * doesn't get stuck on the currently eligible stop task.
6983          *
6984          * We're currently inside stop_machine() and the rq is either stuck
6985          * in the stop_machine_cpu_stop() loop, or we're executing this code,
6986          * either way we should never end up calling schedule() until we're
6987          * done here.
6988          */
6989         rq->stop = NULL;
6990 
6991         /*
6992          * put_prev_task() and pick_next_task() sched
6993          * class method both need to have an up-to-date
6994          * value of rq->clock[_task]
6995          */
6996         update_rq_clock(rq);
6997 
6998 #ifdef CONFIG_SCHED_DEBUG
6999         /* note the clock update in orf */
7000         orf.clock_update_flags |= RQCF_UPDATED;
7001 #endif
7002 
7003         for (;;) {
7004                 /*
7005                  * There's this thread running, bail when that's the only
7006                  * remaining thread:
7007                  */
7008                 if (rq->nr_running == 1)
7009                         break;
7010 
7011                 next = __pick_migrate_task(rq);
7012 
7013                 /*
7014                  * Argh ... no iterator for tasks, we need to remove the
7015                  * kthread from the run-queue to continue.
7016                  */
7017                 if (!force && is_per_cpu_kthread(next)) {
7018                         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&next->percpu_kthread_node);
7019                         list_add(&next->percpu_kthread_node, &percpu_kthreads);
7020 
7021                         /* DEQUEUE_SAVE not used due to move_entity in rt */
7022                         deactivate_task(rq, next,
7023                                         DEQUEUE_NOCLOCK);
7024                         continue;
7025                 }
7026 
7027                 /*
7028                  * Rules for changing task_struct::cpus_mask are holding
7029                  * both pi_lock and rq->lock, such that holding either
7030                  * stabilizes the mask.
7031                  *
7032                  * Drop rq->lock is not quite as disastrous as it usually is
7033                  * because !cpu_active at this point, which means load-balance
7034                  * will not interfere. Also, stop-machine.
7035                  */
7036                 rq_unlock(rq, rf);
7037                 raw_spin_lock(&next->pi_lock);
7038                 rq_relock(rq, rf);
7039 
7040                 /*
7041                  * Since we're inside stop-machine, _nothing_ should have
7042                  * changed the task, WARN if weird stuff happened, because in
7043                  * that case the above rq->lock drop is a fail too.
7044                  */
7045                 if (task_rq(next) != rq || !task_on_rq_queued(next)) {
7046                         /*
7047                          * In the !force case, there is a hole between
7048                          * rq_unlock() and rq_relock(), where another CPU might
7049                          * not observe an up to date cpu_active_mask and try to
7050                          * move tasks around.
7051                          */
7052                         WARN_ON(force);
7053                         raw_spin_unlock(&next->pi_lock);
7054                         continue;
7055                 }
7056 
7057                 /* Find suitable destination for @next, with force if needed. */
7058                 dest_cpu = select_fallback_rq(dead_rq->cpu, next);
7059                 rq = __migrate_task(rq, rf, next, dest_cpu);
7060                 if (rq != dead_rq) {
7061                         rq_unlock(rq, rf);
7062                         rq = dead_rq;
7063                         *rf = orf;
7064                         rq_relock(rq, rf);
7065                 }
7066                 raw_spin_unlock(&next->pi_lock);
7067         }
7068 
7069         list_for_each_entry_safe(next, tmp, &percpu_kthreads,
7070                                  percpu_kthread_node) {
7071 
7072                 /* ENQUEUE_RESTORE not used due to move_entity in rt */
7073                 activate_task(rq, next, ENQUEUE_NOCLOCK);
7074                 list_del(&next->percpu_kthread_node);
7075         }
7076 
7077         rq->stop = stop;
7078 }
7079 
7080 static int drain_rq_cpu_stop(void *data)
7081 {
7082         struct rq *rq = this_rq();
7083         struct rq_flags rf;
7084 
7085         rq_lock_irqsave(rq, &rf);
7086         migrate_tasks(rq, &rf, false);
7087         rq_unlock_irqrestore(rq, &rf);
7088 
7089         return 0;
7090 }
7091 
7092 int sched_cpu_drain_rq(unsigned int cpu)
7093 {
7094         struct cpu_stop_work *rq_drain = &(cpu_rq(cpu)->drain);
7095         struct cpu_stop_done *rq_drain_done = &(cpu_rq(cpu)->drain_done);
7096 
7097         if (idle_cpu(cpu)) {
7098                 rq_drain->done = NULL;
7099                 return 0;
7100         }
7101 
7102         return stop_one_cpu_async(cpu, drain_rq_cpu_stop, NULL, rq_drain,
7103                                   rq_drain_done);
7104 }
7105 
7106 void sched_cpu_drain_rq_wait(unsigned int cpu)
7107 {
7108         struct cpu_stop_work *rq_drain = &(cpu_rq(cpu)->drain);
7109 
7110         if (rq_drain->done)
7111                 cpu_stop_work_wait(rq_drain);
7112 }
7113 #endif /* CONFIG_HOTPLUG_CPU */
7114 
7115 void set_rq_online(struct rq *rq)
7116 {
7117         if (!rq->online) {
7118                 const struct sched_class *class;
7119 
7120                 cpumask_set_cpu(rq->cpu, rq->rd->online);
7121                 rq->online = 1;
7122 
7123                 for_each_class(class) {
7124                         if (class->rq_online)
7125                                 class->rq_online(rq);
7126                 }
7127         }
7128 }
7129 
7130 void set_rq_offline(struct rq *rq)
7131 {
7132         if (rq->online) {
7133                 const struct sched_class *class;
7134 
7135                 for_each_class(class) {
7136                         if (class->rq_offline)
7137                                 class->rq_offline(rq);
7138                 }
7139 
7140                 cpumask_clear_cpu(rq->cpu, rq->rd->online);
7141                 rq->online = 0;
7142         }
7143 }
7144 
7145 /*
7146  * used to mark begin/end of suspend/resume:
7147  */
7148 static int num_cpus_frozen;
7149 
7150 /*
7151  * Update cpusets according to cpu_active mask.  If cpusets are
7152  * disabled, cpuset_update_active_cpus() becomes a simple wrapper
7153  * around partition_sched_domains().
7154  *
7155  * If we come here as part of a suspend/resume, don't touch cpusets because we
7156  * want to restore it back to its original state upon resume anyway.
7157  */
7158 static void cpuset_cpu_active(void)
7159 {
7160         if (cpuhp_tasks_frozen) {
7161                 /*
7162                  * num_cpus_frozen tracks how many CPUs are involved in suspend
7163                  * resume sequence. As long as this is not the last online
7164                  * operation in the resume sequence, just build a single sched
7165                  * domain, ignoring cpusets.
7166                  */
7167                 partition_sched_domains(1, NULL, NULL);
7168                 if (--num_cpus_frozen)
7169                         return;
7170                 /*
7171                  * This is the last CPU online operation. So fall through and
7172                  * restore the original sched domains by considering the
7173                  * cpuset configurations.
7174                  */
7175                 cpuset_force_rebuild();
7176         }
7177         cpuset_update_active_cpus();
7178 }
7179 
7180 static int cpuset_cpu_inactive(unsigned int cpu)
7181 {
7182         if (!cpuhp_tasks_frozen) {
7183                 if (dl_cpu_busy(cpu))
7184                         return -EBUSY;
7185                 cpuset_update_active_cpus();
7186         } else {
7187                 num_cpus_frozen++;
7188                 partition_sched_domains(1, NULL, NULL);
7189         }
7190         return 0;
7191 }
7192 
7193 int sched_cpu_activate(unsigned int cpu)
7194 {
7195         struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(cpu);
7196         struct rq_flags rf;
7197 
7198 #ifdef CONFIG_SCHED_SMT
7199         /*
7200          * When going up, increment the number of cores with SMT present.
7201          */
7202         if (cpumask_weight(cpu_smt_mask(cpu)) == 2)
7203                 static_branch_inc_cpuslocked(&sched_smt_present);
7204 #endif
7205         set_cpu_active(cpu, true);
7206 
7207         if (sched_smp_initialized) {
7208                 sched_domains_numa_masks_set(cpu);
7209                 cpuset_cpu_active();
7210         }
7211 
7212         /*
7213          * Put the rq online, if not already. This happens:
7214          *
7215          * 1) In the early boot process, because we build the real domains
7216          *    after all CPUs have been brought up.
7217          *
7218          * 2) At runtime, if cpuset_cpu_active() fails to rebuild the
7219          *    domains.
7220          */
7221         rq_lock_irqsave(rq, &rf);
7222         if (rq->rd) {
7223                 BUG_ON(!cpumask_test_cpu(cpu, rq->rd->span));
7224                 set_rq_online(rq);
7225         }
7226         rq_unlock_irqrestore(rq, &rf);
7227 
7228         update_max_interval();
7229 
7230         return 0;
7231 }
7232 
7233 int sched_cpus_activate(struct cpumask *cpus)
7234 {
7235         unsigned int cpu;
7236 
7237         for_each_cpu(cpu, cpus) {
7238                 if (sched_cpu_activate(cpu)) {
7239                         for_each_cpu_and(cpu, cpus, cpu_active_mask)
7240                                 sched_cpu_deactivate(cpu);
7241 
7242                         return -EBUSY;
7243                 }
7244         }
7245 
7246         return 0;
7247 }
7248 
7249 int _sched_cpu_deactivate(unsigned int cpu)
7250 {
7251         int ret;
7252 
7253         set_cpu_active(cpu, false);
7254 
7255 #ifdef CONFIG_SCHED_SMT
7256         /*
7257          * When going down, decrement the number of cores with SMT present.
7258          */
7259         if (cpumask_weight(cpu_smt_mask(cpu)) == 2)
7260                 static_branch_dec_cpuslocked(&sched_smt_present);
7261 #endif
7262 
7263         if (!sched_smp_initialized)
7264                 return 0;
7265 
7266         ret = cpuset_cpu_inactive(cpu);
7267         if (ret) {
7268                 set_cpu_active(cpu, true);
7269                 return ret;
7270         }
7271         sched_domains_numa_masks_clear(cpu);
7272 
7273         update_max_interval();
7274 
7275         return 0;
7276 }
7277 
7278 int sched_cpu_deactivate(unsigned int cpu)
7279 {
7280         int ret = _sched_cpu_deactivate(cpu);
7281 
7282         if (ret)
7283                 return ret;
7284 
7285         /*
7286          * We've cleared cpu_active_mask, wait for all preempt-disabled and RCU
7287          * users of this state to go away such that all new such users will
7288          * observe it.
7289          *
7290          * Do sync before park smpboot threads to take care the rcu boost case.
7291          */
7292         synchronize_rcu();
7293 
7294         return 0;
7295 }
7296 
7297 int sched_cpus_deactivate_nosync(struct cpumask *cpus)
7298 {
7299         unsigned int cpu;
7300 
7301         for_each_cpu(cpu, cpus) {
7302                 if (_sched_cpu_deactivate(cpu)) {
7303                         for_each_cpu(cpu, cpus) {
7304                                 if (!cpu_active(cpu))
7305                                         sched_cpu_activate(cpu);
7306                         }
7307 
7308                         return -EBUSY;
7309                 }
7310         }
7311 
7312         return 0;
7313 }
7314 
7315 static void sched_rq_cpu_starting(unsigned int cpu)
7316 {
7317         struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(cpu);
7318 
7319         rq->calc_load_update = calc_load_update;
7320 }
7321 
7322 int sched_cpu_starting(unsigned int cpu)
7323 {
7324         sched_rq_cpu_starting(cpu);
7325         sched_tick_start(cpu);
7326         trace_android_rvh_sched_cpu_starting(cpu);
7327         return 0;
7328 }
7329 
7330 #ifdef CONFIG_HOTPLUG_CPU
7331 int sched_cpu_dying(unsigned int cpu)
7332 {
7333         struct rq *rq = cpu_rq(cpu);
7334         struct rq_flags rf;
7335 
7336         /* Handle pending wakeups and then migrate everything off */
7337         sched_tick_stop(cpu);
7338 
7339         rq_lock_irqsave(rq, &rf);
7340         if (rq->rd) {
7341                 BUG_ON(!cpumask_test_cpu(cpu, rq->rd->span));
7342                 set_rq_offline(rq);
7343         }
7344         migrate_tasks(rq, &rf, true);
7345         BUG_ON(rq->nr_running != 1);
7346         rq_unlock_irqrestore(rq, &rf);
7347 
7348         trace_android_rvh_sched_cpu_dying(cpu);
7349 
7350         calc_load_migrate(rq);
7351         nohz_balance_exit_idle(rq);
7352         hrtick_clear(rq);
7353         return 0;
7354 }
7355 #endif
7356 
7357 void __init sched_init_smp(void)
7358 {
7359         sched_init_numa();
7360 
7361         /*
7362          * There's no userspace yet to cause hotplug operations; hence all the
7363          * CPU masks are stable and all blatant races in the below code cannot
7364          * happen.
7365          */
7366         mutex_lock(&sched_domains_mutex);
7367         sched_init_domains(cpu_active_mask);
7368         mutex_unlock(&sched_domains_mutex);
7369 
7370         /* Move init over to a non-isolated CPU */
7371         if (set_cpus_allowed_ptr(current, housekeeping_cpumask(HK_FLAG_DOMAIN)) < 0)
7372                 BUG();
7373 
7374         sched_init_granularity();
7375 
7376         init_sched_rt_class();
7377         init_sched_dl_class();
7378 
7379         sched_smp_initialized = true;
7380 }
7381 
7382 static int __init migration_init(void)
7383 {
7384         sched_cpu_starting(smp_processor_id());
7385         return 0;
7386 }
7387 early_initcall(migration_init);
7388 
7389 #else
7390 void __init sched_init_smp(void)
7391 {
7392         sched_init_granularity();
7393 }
7394 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
7395 
7396 int in_sched_functions(unsigned long addr)
7397 {
7398         return in_lock_functions(addr) ||
7399                 (addr >= (unsigned long)__sched_text_start
7400                 && addr < (unsigned long)__sched_text_end);
7401 }
7402 
7403 #ifdef CONFIG_CGROUP_SCHED
7404 /*
7405  * Default task group.
7406  * Every task in system belongs to this group at bootup.
7407  */
7408 struct task_group root_task_group;
7409 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(root_task_group);
7410 LIST_HEAD(task_groups);
7411 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(task_groups);
7412 
7413 /* Cacheline aligned slab cache for task_group */
7414 static struct kmem_cache *task_group_cache __read_mostly;
7415 #endif
7416 
7417 DECLARE_PER_CPU(cpumask_var_t, load_balance_mask);
7418 DECLARE_PER_CPU(cpumask_var_t, select_idle_mask);
7419 
7420 void __init sched_init(void)
7421 {
7422         unsigned long ptr = 0;
7423         int i;
7424 
7425         /* Make sure the linker didn't screw up */
7426         BUG_ON(&idle_sched_class + 1 != &fair_sched_class ||
7427                &fair_sched_class + 1 != &rt_sched_class ||
7428                &rt_sched_class + 1   != &dl_sched_class);
7429 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
7430         BUG_ON(&dl_sched_class + 1 != &stop_sched_class);
7431 #endif
7432 
7433         wait_bit_init();
7434 
7435 #ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
7436         ptr += 2 * nr_cpu_ids * sizeof(void **);
7437 #endif
7438 #ifdef CONFIG_RT_GROUP_SCHED
7439         ptr += 2 * nr_cpu_ids * sizeof(void **);
7440 #endif
7441         if (ptr) {
7442                 ptr = (unsigned long)kzalloc(ptr, GFP_NOWAIT);
7443 
7444 #ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
7445                 root_task_group.se = (struct sched_entity **)ptr;
7446                 ptr += nr_cpu_ids * sizeof(void **);
7447 
7448                 root_task_group.cfs_rq = (struct cfs_rq **)ptr;
7449                 ptr += nr_cpu_ids * sizeof(void **);
7450 
7451                 root_task_group.shares = ROOT_TASK_GROUP_LOAD;
7452                 init_cfs_bandwidth(&root_task_group.cfs_bandwidth);
7453 #endif /* CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED */
7454 #ifdef CONFIG_RT_GROUP_SCHED
7455                 root_task_group.rt_se = (struct sched_rt_entity **)ptr;
7456                 ptr += nr_cpu_ids * sizeof(void **);
7457 
7458                 root_task_group.rt_rq = (struct rt_rq **)ptr;
7459                 ptr += nr_cpu_ids * sizeof(void **);
7460 
7461 #endif /* CONFIG_RT_GROUP_SCHED */
7462         }
7463 #ifdef CONFIG_CPUMASK_OFFSTACK
7464         for_each_possible_cpu(i) {
7465                 per_cpu(load_balance_mask, i) = (cpumask_var_t)kzalloc_node(
7466                         cpumask_size(), GFP_KERNEL, cpu_to_node(i));
7467                 per_cpu(select_idle_mask, i) = (cpumask_var_t)kzalloc_node(
7468                         cpumask_size(), GFP_KERNEL, cpu_to_node(i));
7469         }
7470 #endif /* CONFIG_CPUMASK_OFFSTACK */
7471 
7472         init_rt_bandwidth(&def_rt_bandwidth, global_rt_period(), global_rt_runtime());
7473         init_dl_bandwidth(&def_dl_bandwidth, global_rt_period(), global_rt_runtime());
7474 
7475 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
7476         init_defrootdomain();
7477 #endif
7478 
7479 #ifdef CONFIG_RT_GROUP_SCHED
7480         init_rt_bandwidth(&root_task_group.rt_bandwidth,
7481                         global_rt_period(), global_rt_runtime());
7482 #endif /* CONFIG_RT_GROUP_SCHED */
7483 
7484 #ifdef CONFIG_CGROUP_SCHED
7485         task_group_cache = KMEM_CACHE(task_group, 0);
7486 
7487         list_add(&root_task_group.list, &task_groups);
7488         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&root_task_group.children);
7489         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&root_task_group.siblings);
7490         autogroup_init(&init_task);
7491 #endif /* CONFIG_CGROUP_SCHED */
7492 
7493         for_each_possible_cpu(i) {
7494                 struct rq *rq;
7495 
7496                 rq = cpu_rq(i);
7497                 raw_spin_lock_init(&rq->lock);
7498                 rq->nr_running = 0;
7499                 rq->calc_load_active = 0;
7500                 rq->calc_load_update = jiffies + LOAD_FREQ;
7501                 init_cfs_rq(&rq->cfs);
7502                 init_rt_rq(&rq->rt);
7503                 init_dl_rq(&rq->dl);
7504 #ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
7505                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&rq->leaf_cfs_rq_list);
7506                 rq->tmp_alone_branch = &rq->leaf_cfs_rq_list;
7507                 /*
7508                  * How much CPU bandwidth does root_task_group get?
7509                  *
7510                  * In case of task-groups formed thr' the cgroup filesystem, it
7511                  * gets 100% of the CPU resources in the system. This overall
7512                  * system CPU resource is divided among the tasks of
7513                  * root_task_group and its child task-groups in a fair manner,
7514                  * based on each entity's (task or task-group's) weight
7515                  * (se->load.weight).
7516                  *
7517                  * In other words, if root_task_group has 10 tasks of weight
7518                  * 1024) and two child groups A0 and A1 (of weight 1024 each),
7519                  * then A0's share of the CPU resource is:
7520                  *
7521                  *      A0's bandwidth = 1024 / (10*1024 + 1024 + 1024) = 8.33%
7522                  *
7523                  * We achieve this by letting root_task_group's tasks sit
7524                  * directly in rq->cfs (i.e root_task_group->se[] = NULL).
7525                  */
7526                 init_tg_cfs_entry(&root_task_group, &rq->cfs, NULL, i, NULL);
7527 #endif /* CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED */
7528 
7529                 rq->rt.rt_runtime = def_rt_bandwidth.rt_runtime;
7530 #ifdef CONFIG_RT_GROUP_SCHED
7531                 init_tg_rt_entry(&root_task_group, &rq->rt, NULL, i, NULL);
7532 #endif
7533 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
7534                 rq->sd = NULL;
7535                 rq->rd = NULL;
7536                 rq->cpu_capacity = rq->cpu_capacity_orig = SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE;
7537                 rq->balance_callback = NULL;
7538                 rq->active_balance = 0;
7539                 rq->next_balance = jiffies;
7540                 rq->push_cpu = 0;
7541                 rq->cpu = i;
7542                 rq->online = 0;
7543                 rq->idle_stamp = 0;
7544                 rq->avg_idle = 2*sysctl_sched_migration_cost;
7545                 rq->max_idle_balance_cost = sysctl_sched_migration_cost;
7546 
7547                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&rq->cfs_tasks);
7548 
7549                 rq_attach_root(rq, &def_root_domain);
7550 #ifdef CONFIG_NO_HZ_COMMON
7551                 rq->last_blocked_load_update_tick = jiffies;
7552                 atomic_set(&rq->nohz_flags, 0);
7553 
7554                 rq_csd_init(rq, &rq->nohz_csd, nohz_csd_func);
7555 #endif
7556 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
7557                 hrtick_rq_init(rq);
7558                 atomic_set(&rq->nr_iowait, 0);
7559         }
7560 
7561         set_load_weight(&init_task, false);
7562 
7563         /*
7564          * The boot idle thread does lazy MMU switching as well:
7565          */
7566         mmgrab(&init_mm);
7567         enter_lazy_tlb(&init_mm, current);
7568 
7569         /*
7570          * Make us the idle thread. Technically, schedule() should not be
7571          * called from this thread, however somewhere below it might be,
7572          * but because we are the idle thread, we just pick up running again
7573          * when this runqueue becomes "idle".
7574          */
7575         init_idle(current, smp_processor_id());
7576 
7577         calc_load_update = jiffies + LOAD_FREQ;
7578 
7579 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
7580         idle_thread_set_boot_cpu();
7581 #endif
7582         init_sched_fair_class();
7583 
7584         init_schedstats();
7585 
7586         psi_init();
7587 
7588         init_uclamp();
7589 
7590         scheduler_running = 1;
7591 }
7592 
7593 #ifdef CONFIG_DEBUG_ATOMIC_SLEEP
7594 static inline int preempt_count_equals(int preempt_offset)
7595 {
7596         int nested = preempt_count() + rcu_preempt_depth();
7597 
7598         return (nested == preempt_offset);
7599 }
7600 
7601 void __might_sleep(const char *file, int line, int preempt_offset)
7602 {
7603         /*
7604          * Blocking primitives will set (and therefore destroy) current->state,
7605          * since we will exit with TASK_RUNNING make sure we enter with it,
7606          * otherwise we will destroy state.
7607          */
7608         WARN_ONCE(current->state != TASK_RUNNING && current->task_state_change,
7609                         "do not call blocking ops when !TASK_RUNNING; "
7610                         "state=%lx set at [<%p>] %pS\n",
7611                         current->state,
7612                         (void *)current->task_state_change,
7613                         (void *)current->task_state_change);
7614 
7615         ___might_sleep(file, line, preempt_offset);
7616 }
7617 EXPORT_SYMBOL(__might_sleep);
7618 
7619 void ___might_sleep(const char *file, int line, int preempt_offset)
7620 {
7621         /* Ratelimiting timestamp: */
7622         static unsigned long prev_jiffy;
7623 
7624         unsigned long preempt_disable_ip;
7625 
7626         /* WARN_ON_ONCE() by default, no rate limit required: */
7627         rcu_sleep_check();
7628 
7629         if ((preempt_count_equals(preempt_offset) && !irqs_disabled() &&
7630              !is_idle_task(current) && !current->non_block_count) ||
7631             system_state == SYSTEM_BOOTING || system_state > SYSTEM_RUNNING ||
7632             oops_in_progress)
7633                 return;
7634 
7635         if (time_before(jiffies, prev_jiffy + HZ) && prev_jiffy)
7636                 return;
7637         prev_jiffy = jiffies;
7638 
7639         /* Save this before calling printk(), since that will clobber it: */
7640         preempt_disable_ip = get_preempt_disable_ip(current);
7641 
7642         printk(KERN_ERR
7643                 "BUG: sleeping function called from invalid context at %s:%d\n",
7644                         file, line);
7645         printk(KERN_ERR
7646                 "in_atomic(): %d, irqs_disabled(): %d, non_block: %d, pid: %d, name: %s\n",
7647                         in_atomic(), irqs_disabled(), current->non_block_count,
7648                         current->pid, current->comm);
7649 
7650         if (task_stack_end_corrupted(current))
7651                 printk(KERN_EMERG "Thread overran stack, or stack corrupted\n");
7652 
7653         debug_show_held_locks(current);
7654         if (irqs_disabled())
7655                 print_irqtrace_events(current);
7656         if (IS_ENABLED(CONFIG_DEBUG_PREEMPT)
7657             && !preempt_count_equals(preempt_offset)) {
7658                 pr_err("Preemption disabled at:");
7659                 print_ip_sym(KERN_ERR, preempt_disable_ip);
7660         }
7661 
7662         trace_android_rvh_schedule_bug(NULL);
7663 
7664         dump_stack();
7665         add_taint(TAINT_WARN, LOCKDEP_STILL_OK);
7666 }
7667 EXPORT_SYMBOL(___might_sleep);
7668 
7669 void __cant_sleep(const char *file, int line, int preempt_offset)
7670 {
7671         static unsigned long prev_jiffy;
7672 
7673         if (irqs_disabled())
7674                 return;
7675 
7676         if (!IS_ENABLED(CONFIG_PREEMPT_COUNT))
7677                 return;
7678 
7679         if (preempt_count() > preempt_offset)
7680                 return;
7681 
7682         if (time_before(jiffies, prev_jiffy + HZ) && prev_jiffy)
7683                 return;
7684         prev_jiffy = jiffies;
7685 
7686         printk(KERN_ERR "BUG: assuming atomic context at %s:%d\n", file, line);
7687         printk(KERN_ERR "in_atomic(): %d, irqs_disabled(): %d, pid: %d, name: %s\n",
7688                         in_atomic(), irqs_disabled(),
7689                         current->pid, current->comm);
7690 
7691         debug_show_held_locks(current);
7692         dump_stack();
7693         add_taint(TAINT_WARN, LOCKDEP_STILL_OK);
7694 }
7695 EXPORT_SYMBOL_GPL(__cant_sleep);
7696 #endif
7697 
7698 #ifdef CONFIG_MAGIC_SYSRQ
7699 void normalize_rt_tasks(void)
7700 {
7701         struct task_struct *g, *p;
7702         struct sched_attr attr = {
7703                 .sched_policy = SCHED_NORMAL,
7704         };
7705 
7706         read_lock(&tasklist_lock);
7707         for_each_process_thread(g, p) {
7708                 /*
7709                  * Only normalize user tasks:
7710                  */
7711                 if (p->flags & PF_KTHREAD)
7712                         continue;
7713 
7714                 p->se.exec_start = 0;
7715                 schedstat_set(p->se.statistics.wait_start,  0);
7716                 schedstat_set(p->se.statistics.sleep_start, 0);
7717                 schedstat_set(p->se.statistics.block_start, 0);
7718 
7719                 if (!dl_task(p) && !rt_task(p)) {
7720                         /*
7721                          * Renice negative nice level userspace
7722                          * tasks back to 0:
7723                          */
7724                         if (task_nice(p) < 0)
7725                                 set_user_nice(p, 0);
7726                         continue;
7727                 }
7728 
7729                 __sched_setscheduler(p, &attr, false, false);
7730         }
7731         read_unlock(&tasklist_lock);
7732 }
7733 
7734 #endif /* CONFIG_MAGIC_SYSRQ */
7735 
7736 #if defined(CONFIG_IA64) || defined(CONFIG_KGDB_KDB)
7737 /*
7738  * These functions are only useful for the IA64 MCA handling, or kdb.
7739  *
7740  * They can only be called when the whole system has been
7741  * stopped - every CPU needs to be quiescent, and no scheduling
7742  * activity can take place. Using them for anything else would
7743  * be a serious bug, and as a result, they aren't even visible
7744  * under any other configuration.
7745  */
7746 
7747 /**
7748  * curr_task - return the current task for a given CPU.
7749  * @cpu: the processor in question.
7750  *
7751  * ONLY VALID WHEN THE WHOLE SYSTEM IS STOPPED!
7752  *
7753  * Return: The current task for @cpu.
7754  */
7755 struct task_struct *curr_task(int cpu)
7756 {
7757         return cpu_curr(cpu);
7758 }
7759 
7760 #endif /* defined(CONFIG_IA64) || defined(CONFIG_KGDB_KDB) */
7761 
7762 #ifdef CONFIG_IA64
7763 /**
7764  * ia64_set_curr_task - set the current task for a given CPU.
7765  * @cpu: the processor in question.
7766  * @p: the task pointer to set.
7767  *
7768  * Description: This function must only be used when non-maskable interrupts
7769  * are serviced on a separate stack. It allows the architecture to switch the
7770  * notion of the current task on a CPU in a non-blocking manner. This function
7771  * must be called with all CPU's synchronized, and interrupts disabled, the
7772  * and caller must save the original value of the current task (see
7773  * curr_task() above) and restore that value before reenabling interrupts and
7774  * re-starting the system.
7775  *
7776  * ONLY VALID WHEN THE WHOLE SYSTEM IS STOPPED!
7777  */
7778 void ia64_set_curr_task(int cpu, struct task_struct *p)
7779 {
7780         cpu_curr(cpu) = p;
7781 }
7782 
7783 #endif
7784 
7785 #ifdef CONFIG_CGROUP_SCHED
7786 /* task_group_lock serializes the addition/removal of task groups */
7787 static DEFINE_SPINLOCK(task_group_lock);
7788 
7789 static inline void alloc_uclamp_sched_group(struct task_group *tg,
7790                                             struct task_group *parent)
7791 {
7792 #ifdef CONFIG_UCLAMP_TASK_GROUP
7793         enum uclamp_id clamp_id;
7794 
7795         for_each_clamp_id(clamp_id) {
7796                 uclamp_se_set(&tg->uclamp_req[clamp_id],
7797                               uclamp_none(clamp_id), false);
7798                 tg->uclamp[clamp_id] = parent->uclamp[clamp_id];
7799         }
7800 #endif
7801 }
7802 
7803 static void sched_free_group(struct task_group *tg)
7804 {
7805         free_fair_sched_group(tg);
7806         free_rt_sched_group(tg);
7807         autogroup_free(tg);
7808         kmem_cache_free(task_group_cache, tg);
7809 }
7810 
7811 /* allocate runqueue etc for a new task group */
7812 struct task_group *sched_create_group(struct task_group *parent)
7813 {
7814         struct task_group *tg;
7815 
7816         tg = kmem_cache_alloc(task_group_cache, GFP_KERNEL | __GFP_ZERO);
7817         if (!tg)
7818                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
7819 
7820         if (!alloc_fair_sched_group(tg, parent))
7821                 goto err;
7822 
7823         if (!alloc_rt_sched_group(tg, parent))
7824                 goto err;
7825 
7826         alloc_uclamp_sched_group(tg, parent);
7827 
7828         return tg;
7829 
7830 err:
7831         sched_free_group(tg);
7832         return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
7833 }
7834 
7835 void sched_online_group(struct task_group *tg, struct task_group *parent)
7836 {
7837         unsigned long flags;
7838 
7839         spin_lock_irqsave(&task_group_lock, flags);
7840         list_add_rcu(&tg->list, &task_groups);
7841 
7842         /* Root should already exist: */
7843         WARN_ON(!parent);
7844 
7845         tg->parent = parent;
7846         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&tg->children);
7847         list_add_rcu(&tg->siblings, &parent->children);
7848         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&task_group_lock, flags);
7849 
7850         online_fair_sched_group(tg);
7851 }
7852 
7853 /* rcu callback to free various structures associated with a task group */
7854 static void sched_free_group_rcu(struct rcu_head *rhp)
7855 {
7856         /* Now it should be safe to free those cfs_rqs: */
7857         sched_free_group(container_of(rhp, struct task_group, rcu));
7858 }
7859 
7860 void sched_destroy_group(struct task_group *tg)
7861 {
7862         /* Wait for possible concurrent references to cfs_rqs complete: */
7863         call_rcu(&tg->rcu, sched_free_group_rcu);
7864 }
7865 
7866 void sched_offline_group(struct task_group *tg)
7867 {
7868         unsigned long flags;
7869 
7870         /* End participation in shares distribution: */
7871         unregister_fair_sched_group(tg);
7872 
7873         spin_lock_irqsave(&task_group_lock, flags);
7874         list_del_rcu(&tg->list);
7875         list_del_rcu(&tg->siblings);
7876         spin_unlock_irqrestore(&task_group_lock, flags);
7877 }
7878 
7879 static void sched_change_group(struct task_struct *tsk, int type)
7880 {
7881         struct task_group *tg;
7882 
7883         /*
7884          * All callers are synchronized by task_rq_lock(); we do not use RCU
7885          * which is pointless here. Thus, we pass "true" to task_css_check()
7886          * to prevent lockdep warnings.
7887          */
7888         tg = container_of(task_css_check(tsk, cpu_cgrp_id, true),
7889                           struct task_group, css);
7890         tg = autogroup_task_group(tsk, tg);
7891         tsk->sched_task_group = tg;
7892 
7893 #ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
7894         if (tsk->sched_class->task_change_group)
7895                 tsk->sched_class->task_change_group(tsk, type);
7896         else
7897 #endif
7898                 set_task_rq(tsk, task_cpu(tsk));
7899 }
7900 
7901 /*
7902  * Change task's runqueue when it moves between groups.
7903  *
7904  * The caller of this function should have put the task in its new group by
7905  * now. This function just updates tsk->se.cfs_rq and tsk->se.parent to reflect
7906  * its new group.
7907  */
7908 void sched_move_task(struct task_struct *tsk)
7909 {
7910         int queued, running, queue_flags =
7911                 DEQUEUE_SAVE | DEQUEUE_MOVE | DEQUEUE_NOCLOCK;
7912         struct rq_flags rf;
7913         struct rq *rq;
7914 
7915         rq = task_rq_lock(tsk, &rf);
7916         update_rq_clock(rq);
7917 
7918         running = task_current(rq, tsk);
7919         queued = task_on_rq_queued(tsk);
7920 
7921         if (queued)
7922                 dequeue_task(rq, tsk, queue_flags);
7923         if (running)
7924                 put_prev_task(rq, tsk);
7925 
7926         sched_change_group(tsk, TASK_MOVE_GROUP);
7927 
7928         if (queued)
7929                 enqueue_task(rq, tsk, queue_flags);
7930         if (running) {
7931                 set_next_task(rq, tsk);
7932                 /*
7933                  * After changing group, the running task may have joined a
7934                  * throttled one but it's still the running task. Trigger a
7935                  * resched to make sure that task can still run.
7936                  */
7937                 resched_curr(rq);
7938         }
7939 
7940         task_rq_unlock(rq, tsk, &rf);
7941 }
7942 
7943 static inline struct task_group *css_tg(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css)
7944 {
7945         return css ? container_of(css, struct task_group, css) : NULL;
7946 }
7947 
7948 static struct cgroup_subsys_state *
7949 cpu_cgroup_css_alloc(struct cgroup_subsys_state *parent_css)
7950 {
7951         struct task_group *parent = css_tg(parent_css);
7952         struct task_group *tg;
7953 
7954         if (!parent) {
7955                 /* This is early initialization for the top cgroup */
7956                 return &root_task_group.css;
7957         }
7958 
7959         tg = sched_create_group(parent);
7960         if (IS_ERR(tg))
7961                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
7962 
7963         return &tg->css;
7964 }
7965 
7966 /* Expose task group only after completing cgroup initialization */
7967 static int cpu_cgroup_css_online(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css)
7968 {
7969         struct task_group *tg = css_tg(css);
7970         struct task_group *parent = css_tg(css->parent);
7971 
7972         if (parent)
7973                 sched_online_group(tg, parent);
7974 
7975 #ifdef CONFIG_UCLAMP_TASK_GROUP
7976         /* Propagate the effective uclamp value for the new group */
7977         cpu_util_update_eff(css);
7978 #endif
7979 
7980         trace_android_rvh_cpu_cgroup_online(css);
7981         return 0;
7982 }
7983 
7984 static void cpu_cgroup_css_released(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css)
7985 {
7986         struct task_group *tg = css_tg(css);
7987 
7988         sched_offline_group(tg);
7989 }
7990 
7991 static void cpu_cgroup_css_free(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css)
7992 {
7993         struct task_group *tg = css_tg(css);
7994 
7995         /*
7996          * Relies on the RCU grace period between css_released() and this.
7997          */
7998         sched_free_group(tg);
7999 }
8000 
8001 /*
8002  * This is called before wake_up_new_task(), therefore we really only
8003  * have to set its group bits, all the other stuff does not apply.
8004  */
8005 static void cpu_cgroup_fork(struct task_struct *task)
8006 {
8007         struct rq_flags rf;
8008         struct rq *rq;
8009 
8010         rq = task_rq_lock(task, &rf);
8011 
8012         update_rq_clock(rq);
8013         sched_change_group(task, TASK_SET_GROUP);
8014 
8015         task_rq_unlock(rq, task, &rf);
8016 }
8017 
8018 static int cpu_cgroup_can_attach(struct cgroup_taskset *tset)
8019 {
8020         struct task_struct *task;
8021         struct cgroup_subsys_state *css;
8022         int ret = 0;
8023 
8024         cgroup_taskset_for_each(task, css, tset) {
8025 #ifdef CONFIG_RT_GROUP_SCHED
8026                 if (!sched_rt_can_attach(css_tg(css), task))
8027                         return -EINVAL;
8028 #endif
8029                 /*
8030                  * Serialize against wake_up_new_task() such that if its
8031                  * running, we're sure to observe its full state.
8032                  */
8033                 raw_spin_lock_irq(&task->pi_lock);
8034                 /*
8035                  * Avoid calling sched_move_task() before wake_up_new_task()
8036                  * has happened. This would lead to problems with PELT, due to
8037                  * move wanting to detach+attach while we're not attached yet.
8038                  */
8039                 if (task->state == TASK_NEW)
8040                         ret = -EINVAL;
8041                 raw_spin_unlock_irq(&task->pi_lock);
8042 
8043                 if (ret)
8044                         break;
8045         }
8046 
8047         trace_android_rvh_cpu_cgroup_can_attach(tset, &ret);
8048 
8049         return ret;
8050 }
8051 
8052 static void cpu_cgroup_attach(struct cgroup_taskset *tset)
8053 {
8054         struct task_struct *task;
8055         struct cgroup_subsys_state *css;
8056 
8057         cgroup_taskset_for_each(task, css, tset)
8058                 sched_move_task(task);
8059 
8060         trace_android_rvh_cpu_cgroup_attach(tset);
8061 }
8062 
8063 #ifdef CONFIG_UCLAMP_TASK_GROUP
8064 static void cpu_util_update_eff(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css)
8065 {
8066         struct cgroup_subsys_state *top_css = css;
8067         struct uclamp_se *uc_parent = NULL;
8068         struct uclamp_se *uc_se = NULL;
8069         unsigned int eff[UCLAMP_CNT];
8070         enum uclamp_id clamp_id;
8071         unsigned int clamps;
8072 
8073         css_for_each_descendant_pre(css, top_css) {
8074                 uc_parent = css_tg(css)->parent
8075                         ? css_tg(css)->parent->uclamp : NULL;
8076 
8077                 for_each_clamp_id(clamp_id) {
8078                         /* Assume effective clamps matches requested clamps */
8079                         eff[clamp_id] = css_tg(css)->uclamp_req[clamp_id].value;
8080                         /* Cap effective clamps with parent's effective clamps */
8081                         if (uc_parent &&
8082                             eff[clamp_id] > uc_parent[clamp_id].value) {
8083                                 eff[clamp_id] = uc_parent[clamp_id].value;
8084                         }
8085                 }
8086                 /* Ensure protection is always capped by limit */
8087                 eff[UCLAMP_MIN] = min(eff[UCLAMP_MIN], eff[UCLAMP_MAX]);
8088 
8089                 /* Propagate most restrictive effective clamps */
8090                 clamps = 0x0;
8091                 uc_se = css_tg(css)->uclamp;
8092                 for_each_clamp_id(clamp_id) {
8093                         if (eff[clamp_id] == uc_se[clamp_id].value)
8094                                 continue;
8095                         uc_se[clamp_id].value = eff[clamp_id];
8096                         uc_se[clamp_id].bucket_id = uclamp_bucket_id(eff[clamp_id]);
8097                         clamps |= (0x1 << clamp_id);
8098                 }
8099                 if (!clamps) {
8100                         css = css_rightmost_descendant(css);
8101                         continue;
8102                 }
8103 
8104                 /* Immediately update descendants RUNNABLE tasks */
8105                 uclamp_update_active_tasks(css, clamps);
8106         }
8107 }
8108 
8109 /*
8110  * Integer 10^N with a given N exponent by casting to integer the literal "1eN"
8111  * C expression. Since there is no way to convert a macro argument (N) into a
8112  * character constant, use two levels of macros.
8113  */
8114 #define _POW10(exp) ((unsigned int)1e##exp)
8115 #define POW10(exp) _POW10(exp)
8116 
8117 struct uclamp_request {
8118 #define UCLAMP_PERCENT_SHIFT    2
8119 #define UCLAMP_PERCENT_SCALE    (100 * POW10(UCLAMP_PERCENT_SHIFT))
8120         s64 percent;
8121         u64 util;
8122         int ret;
8123 };
8124 
8125 static inline struct uclamp_request
8126 capacity_from_percent(char *buf)
8127 {
8128         struct uclamp_request req = {
8129                 .percent = UCLAMP_PERCENT_SCALE,
8130                 .util = SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE,
8131                 .ret = 0,
8132         };
8133 
8134         buf = strim(buf);
8135         if (strcmp(buf, "max")) {
8136                 req.ret = cgroup_parse_float(buf, UCLAMP_PERCENT_SHIFT,
8137                                              &req.percent);
8138                 if (req.ret)
8139                         return req;
8140                 if ((u64)req.percent > UCLAMP_PERCENT_SCALE) {
8141                         req.ret = -ERANGE;
8142                         return req;
8143                 }
8144 
8145                 req.util = req.percent << SCHED_CAPACITY_SHIFT;
8146                 req.util = DIV_ROUND_CLOSEST_ULL(req.util, UCLAMP_PERCENT_SCALE);
8147         }
8148 
8149         return req;
8150 }
8151 
8152 static ssize_t cpu_uclamp_write(struct kernfs_open_file *of, char *buf,
8153                                 size_t nbytes, loff_t off,
8154                                 enum uclamp_id clamp_id)
8155 {
8156         struct uclamp_request req;
8157         struct task_group *tg;
8158 
8159         req = capacity_from_percent(buf);
8160         if (req.ret)
8161                 return req.ret;
8162 
8163         static_branch_enable(&sched_uclamp_used);
8164 
8165         mutex_lock(&uclamp_mutex);
8166         rcu_read_lock();
8167 
8168         tg = css_tg(of_css(of));
8169         if (tg->uclamp_req[clamp_id].value != req.util)
8170                 uclamp_se_set(&tg->uclamp_req[clamp_id], req.util, false);
8171 
8172         /*
8173          * Because of not recoverable conversion rounding we keep track of the
8174          * exact requested value
8175          */
8176         tg->uclamp_pct[clamp_id] = req.percent;
8177 
8178         /* Update effective clamps to track the most restrictive value */
8179         cpu_util_update_eff(of_css(of));
8180 
8181         rcu_read_unlock();
8182         mutex_unlock(&uclamp_mutex);
8183 
8184         return nbytes;
8185 }
8186 
8187 static ssize_t cpu_uclamp_min_write(struct kernfs_open_file *of,
8188                                     char *buf, size_t nbytes,
8189                                     loff_t off)
8190 {
8191         return cpu_uclamp_write(of, buf, nbytes, off, UCLAMP_MIN);
8192 }
8193 
8194 static ssize_t cpu_uclamp_max_write(struct kernfs_open_file *of,
8195                                     char *buf, size_t nbytes,
8196                                     loff_t off)
8197 {
8198         return cpu_uclamp_write(of, buf, nbytes, off, UCLAMP_MAX);
8199 }
8200 
8201 static inline void cpu_uclamp_print(struct seq_file *sf,
8202                                     enum uclamp_id clamp_id)
8203 {
8204         struct task_group *tg;
8205         u64 util_clamp;
8206         u64 percent;
8207         u32 rem;
8208 
8209         rcu_read_lock();
8210         tg = css_tg(seq_css(sf));
8211         util_clamp = tg->uclamp_req[clamp_id].value;
8212         rcu_read_unlock();
8213 
8214         if (util_clamp == SCHED_CAPACITY_SCALE) {
8215                 seq_puts(sf, "max\n");
8216                 return;
8217         }
8218 
8219         percent = tg->uclamp_pct[clamp_id];
8220         percent = div_u64_rem(percent, POW10(UCLAMP_PERCENT_SHIFT), &rem);
8221         seq_printf(sf, "%llu.%0*u\n", percent, UCLAMP_PERCENT_SHIFT, rem);
8222 }
8223 
8224 static int cpu_uclamp_min_show(struct seq_file *sf, void *v)
8225 {
8226         cpu_uclamp_print(sf, UCLAMP_MIN);
8227         return 0;
8228 }
8229 
8230 static int cpu_uclamp_max_show(struct seq_file *sf, void *v)
8231 {
8232         cpu_uclamp_print(sf, UCLAMP_MAX);
8233         return 0;
8234 }
8235 
8236 static int cpu_uclamp_ls_write_u64(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8237                                    struct cftype *cftype, u64 ls)
8238 {
8239         struct task_group *tg;
8240 
8241         if (ls > 1)
8242                 return -EINVAL;
8243         tg = css_tg(css);
8244         tg->latency_sensitive = (unsigned int) ls;
8245 
8246         return 0;
8247 }
8248 
8249 static u64 cpu_uclamp_ls_read_u64(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8250                                   struct cftype *cft)
8251 {
8252         struct task_group *tg = css_tg(css);
8253 
8254         return (u64) tg->latency_sensitive;
8255 }
8256 #endif /* CONFIG_UCLAMP_TASK_GROUP */
8257 
8258 #ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
8259 static int cpu_shares_write_u64(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8260                                 struct cftype *cftype, u64 shareval)
8261 {
8262         if (shareval > scale_load_down(ULONG_MAX))
8263                 shareval = MAX_SHARES;
8264         return sched_group_set_shares(css_tg(css), scale_load(shareval));
8265 }
8266 
8267 static u64 cpu_shares_read_u64(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8268                                struct cftype *cft)
8269 {
8270         struct task_group *tg = css_tg(css);
8271 
8272         return (u64) scale_load_down(tg->shares);
8273 }
8274 
8275 #ifdef CONFIG_CFS_BANDWIDTH
8276 static DEFINE_MUTEX(cfs_constraints_mutex);
8277 
8278 const u64 max_cfs_quota_period = 1 * NSEC_PER_SEC; /* 1s */
8279 static const u64 min_cfs_quota_period = 1 * NSEC_PER_MSEC; /* 1ms */
8280 /* More than 203 days if BW_SHIFT equals 20. */
8281 static const u64 max_cfs_runtime = MAX_BW * NSEC_PER_USEC;
8282 
8283 static int __cfs_schedulable(struct task_group *tg, u64 period, u64 runtime);
8284 
8285 static int tg_set_cfs_bandwidth(struct task_group *tg, u64 period, u64 quota)
8286 {
8287         int i, ret = 0, runtime_enabled, runtime_was_enabled;
8288         struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b = &tg->cfs_bandwidth;
8289 
8290         if (tg == &root_task_group)
8291                 return -EINVAL;
8292 
8293         /*
8294          * Ensure we have at some amount of bandwidth every period.  This is
8295          * to prevent reaching a state of large arrears when throttled via
8296          * entity_tick() resulting in prolonged exit starvation.
8297          */
8298         if (quota < min_cfs_quota_period || period < min_cfs_quota_period)
8299                 return -EINVAL;
8300 
8301         /*
8302          * Likewise, bound things on the otherside by preventing insane quota
8303          * periods.  This also allows us to normalize in computing quota
8304          * feasibility.
8305          */
8306         if (period > max_cfs_quota_period)
8307                 return -EINVAL;
8308 
8309         /*
8310          * Bound quota to defend quota against overflow during bandwidth shift.
8311          */
8312         if (quota != RUNTIME_INF && quota > max_cfs_runtime)
8313                 return -EINVAL;
8314 
8315         /*
8316          * Prevent race between setting of cfs_rq->runtime_enabled and
8317          * unthrottle_offline_cfs_rqs().
8318          */
8319         get_online_cpus();
8320         mutex_lock(&cfs_constraints_mutex);
8321         ret = __cfs_schedulable(tg, period, quota);
8322         if (ret)
8323                 goto out_unlock;
8324 
8325         runtime_enabled = quota != RUNTIME_INF;
8326         runtime_was_enabled = cfs_b->quota != RUNTIME_INF;
8327         /*
8328          * If we need to toggle cfs_bandwidth_used, off->on must occur
8329          * before making related changes, and on->off must occur afterwards
8330          */
8331         if (runtime_enabled && !runtime_was_enabled)
8332                 cfs_bandwidth_usage_inc();
8333         raw_spin_lock_irq(&cfs_b->lock);
8334         cfs_b->period = ns_to_ktime(period);
8335         cfs_b->quota = quota;
8336 
8337         __refill_cfs_bandwidth_runtime(cfs_b);
8338 
8339         /* Restart the period timer (if active) to handle new period expiry: */
8340         if (runtime_enabled)
8341                 start_cfs_bandwidth(cfs_b);
8342 
8343         raw_spin_unlock_irq(&cfs_b->lock);
8344 
8345         for_each_online_cpu(i) {
8346                 struct cfs_rq *cfs_rq = tg->cfs_rq[i];
8347                 struct rq *rq = cfs_rq->rq;
8348                 struct rq_flags rf;
8349 
8350                 rq_lock_irq(rq, &rf);
8351                 cfs_rq->runtime_enabled = runtime_enabled;
8352                 cfs_rq->runtime_remaining = 0;
8353 
8354                 if (cfs_rq->throttled)
8355                         unthrottle_cfs_rq(cfs_rq);
8356                 rq_unlock_irq(rq, &rf);
8357         }
8358         if (runtime_was_enabled && !runtime_enabled)
8359                 cfs_bandwidth_usage_dec();
8360 out_unlock:
8361         mutex_unlock(&cfs_constraints_mutex);
8362         put_online_cpus();
8363 
8364         return ret;
8365 }
8366 
8367 static int tg_set_cfs_quota(struct task_group *tg, long cfs_quota_us)
8368 {
8369         u64 quota, period;
8370 
8371         period = ktime_to_ns(tg->cfs_bandwidth.period);
8372         if (cfs_quota_us < 0)
8373                 quota = RUNTIME_INF;
8374         else if ((u64)cfs_quota_us <= U64_MAX / NSEC_PER_USEC)
8375                 quota = (u64)cfs_quota_us * NSEC_PER_USEC;
8376         else
8377                 return -EINVAL;
8378 
8379         return tg_set_cfs_bandwidth(tg, period, quota);
8380 }
8381 
8382 static long tg_get_cfs_quota(struct task_group *tg)
8383 {
8384         u64 quota_us;
8385 
8386         if (tg->cfs_bandwidth.quota == RUNTIME_INF)
8387                 return -1;
8388 
8389         quota_us = tg->cfs_bandwidth.quota;
8390         do_div(quota_us, NSEC_PER_USEC);
8391 
8392         return quota_us;
8393 }
8394 
8395 static int tg_set_cfs_period(struct task_group *tg, long cfs_period_us)
8396 {
8397         u64 quota, period;
8398 
8399         if ((u64)cfs_period_us > U64_MAX / NSEC_PER_USEC)
8400                 return -EINVAL;
8401 
8402         period = (u64)cfs_period_us * NSEC_PER_USEC;
8403         quota = tg->cfs_bandwidth.quota;
8404 
8405         return tg_set_cfs_bandwidth(tg, period, quota);
8406 }
8407 
8408 static long tg_get_cfs_period(struct task_group *tg)
8409 {
8410         u64 cfs_period_us;
8411 
8412         cfs_period_us = ktime_to_ns(tg->cfs_bandwidth.period);
8413         do_div(cfs_period_us, NSEC_PER_USEC);
8414 
8415         return cfs_period_us;
8416 }
8417 
8418 static s64 cpu_cfs_quota_read_s64(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8419                                   struct cftype *cft)
8420 {
8421         return tg_get_cfs_quota(css_tg(css));
8422 }
8423 
8424 static int cpu_cfs_quota_write_s64(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8425                                    struct cftype *cftype, s64 cfs_quota_us)
8426 {
8427         return tg_set_cfs_quota(css_tg(css), cfs_quota_us);
8428 }
8429 
8430 static u64 cpu_cfs_period_read_u64(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8431                                    struct cftype *cft)
8432 {
8433         return tg_get_cfs_period(css_tg(css));
8434 }
8435 
8436 static int cpu_cfs_period_write_u64(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8437                                     struct cftype *cftype, u64 cfs_period_us)
8438 {
8439         return tg_set_cfs_period(css_tg(css), cfs_period_us);
8440 }
8441 
8442 struct cfs_schedulable_data {
8443         struct task_group *tg;
8444         u64 period, quota;
8445 };
8446 
8447 /*
8448  * normalize group quota/period to be quota/max_period
8449  * note: units are usecs
8450  */
8451 static u64 normalize_cfs_quota(struct task_group *tg,
8452                                struct cfs_schedulable_data *d)
8453 {
8454         u64 quota, period;
8455 
8456         if (tg == d->tg) {
8457                 period = d->period;
8458                 quota = d->quota;
8459         } else {
8460                 period = tg_get_cfs_period(tg);
8461                 quota = tg_get_cfs_quota(tg);
8462         }
8463 
8464         /* note: these should typically be equivalent */
8465         if (quota == RUNTIME_INF || quota == -1)
8466                 return RUNTIME_INF;
8467 
8468         return to_ratio(period, quota);
8469 }
8470 
8471 static int tg_cfs_schedulable_down(struct task_group *tg, void *data)
8472 {
8473         struct cfs_schedulable_data *d = data;
8474         struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b = &tg->cfs_bandwidth;
8475         s64 quota = 0, parent_quota = -1;
8476 
8477         if (!tg->parent) {
8478                 quota = RUNTIME_INF;
8479         } else {
8480                 struct cfs_bandwidth *parent_b = &tg->parent->cfs_bandwidth;
8481 
8482                 quota = normalize_cfs_quota(tg, d);
8483                 parent_quota = parent_b->hierarchical_quota;
8484 
8485                 /*
8486                  * Ensure max(child_quota) <= parent_quota.  On cgroup2,
8487                  * always take the min.  On cgroup1, only inherit when no
8488                  * limit is set:
8489                  */
8490                 if (cgroup_subsys_on_dfl(cpu_cgrp_subsys)) {
8491                         quota = min(quota, parent_quota);
8492                 } else {
8493                         if (quota == RUNTIME_INF)
8494                                 quota = parent_quota;
8495                         else if (parent_quota != RUNTIME_INF && quota > parent_quota)
8496                                 return -EINVAL;
8497                 }
8498         }
8499         cfs_b->hierarchical_quota = quota;
8500 
8501         return 0;
8502 }
8503 
8504 static int __cfs_schedulable(struct task_group *tg, u64 period, u64 quota)
8505 {
8506         int ret;
8507         struct cfs_schedulable_data data = {
8508                 .tg = tg,
8509                 .period = period,
8510                 .quota = quota,
8511         };
8512 
8513         if (quota != RUNTIME_INF) {
8514                 do_div(data.period, NSEC_PER_USEC);
8515                 do_div(data.quota, NSEC_PER_USEC);
8516         }
8517 
8518         rcu_read_lock();
8519         ret = walk_tg_tree(tg_cfs_schedulable_down, tg_nop, &data);
8520         rcu_read_unlock();
8521 
8522         return ret;
8523 }
8524 
8525 static int cpu_cfs_stat_show(struct seq_file *sf, void *v)
8526 {
8527         struct task_group *tg = css_tg(seq_css(sf));
8528         struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b = &tg->cfs_bandwidth;
8529 
8530         seq_printf(sf, "nr_periods %d\n", cfs_b->nr_periods);
8531         seq_printf(sf, "nr_throttled %d\n", cfs_b->nr_throttled);
8532         seq_printf(sf, "throttled_time %llu\n", cfs_b->throttled_time);
8533 
8534         if (schedstat_enabled() && tg != &root_task_group) {
8535                 u64 ws = 0;
8536                 int i;
8537 
8538                 for_each_possible_cpu(i)
8539                         ws += schedstat_val(tg->se[i]->statistics.wait_sum);
8540 
8541                 seq_printf(sf, "wait_sum %llu\n", ws);
8542         }
8543 
8544         return 0;
8545 }
8546 #endif /* CONFIG_CFS_BANDWIDTH */
8547 #endif /* CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED */
8548 
8549 #ifdef CONFIG_RT_GROUP_SCHED
8550 static int cpu_rt_runtime_write(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8551                                 struct cftype *cft, s64 val)
8552 {
8553         return sched_group_set_rt_runtime(css_tg(css), val);
8554 }
8555 
8556 static s64 cpu_rt_runtime_read(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8557                                struct cftype *cft)
8558 {
8559         return sched_group_rt_runtime(css_tg(css));
8560 }
8561 
8562 static int cpu_rt_period_write_uint(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8563                                     struct cftype *cftype, u64 rt_period_us)
8564 {
8565         return sched_group_set_rt_period(css_tg(css), rt_period_us);
8566 }
8567 
8568 static u64 cpu_rt_period_read_uint(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8569                                    struct cftype *cft)
8570 {
8571         return sched_group_rt_period(css_tg(css));
8572 }
8573 #endif /* CONFIG_RT_GROUP_SCHED */
8574 
8575 static struct cftype cpu_legacy_files[] = {
8576 #ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
8577         {
8578                 .name = "shares",
8579                 .read_u64 = cpu_shares_read_u64,
8580                 .write_u64 = cpu_shares_write_u64,
8581         },
8582 #endif
8583 #ifdef CONFIG_CFS_BANDWIDTH
8584         {
8585                 .name = "cfs_quota_us",
8586                 .read_s64 = cpu_cfs_quota_read_s64,
8587                 .write_s64 = cpu_cfs_quota_write_s64,
8588         },
8589         {
8590                 .name = "cfs_period_us",
8591                 .read_u64 = cpu_cfs_period_read_u64,
8592                 .write_u64 = cpu_cfs_period_write_u64,
8593         },
8594         {
8595                 .name = "stat",
8596                 .seq_show = cpu_cfs_stat_show,
8597         },
8598 #endif
8599 #ifdef CONFIG_RT_GROUP_SCHED
8600         {
8601                 .name = "rt_runtime_us",
8602                 .read_s64 = cpu_rt_runtime_read,
8603                 .write_s64 = cpu_rt_runtime_write,
8604         },
8605         {
8606                 .name = "rt_period_us",
8607                 .read_u64 = cpu_rt_period_read_uint,
8608                 .write_u64 = cpu_rt_period_write_uint,
8609         },
8610 #endif
8611 #ifdef CONFIG_UCLAMP_TASK_GROUP
8612         {
8613                 .name = "uclamp.min",
8614                 .flags = CFTYPE_NOT_ON_ROOT,
8615                 .seq_show = cpu_uclamp_min_show,
8616                 .write = cpu_uclamp_min_write,
8617         },
8618         {
8619                 .name = "uclamp.max",
8620                 .flags = CFTYPE_NOT_ON_ROOT,
8621                 .seq_show = cpu_uclamp_max_show,
8622                 .write = cpu_uclamp_max_write,
8623         },
8624         {
8625                 .name = "uclamp.latency_sensitive",
8626                 .flags = CFTYPE_NOT_ON_ROOT,
8627                 .read_u64 = cpu_uclamp_ls_read_u64,
8628                 .write_u64 = cpu_uclamp_ls_write_u64,
8629         },
8630 #endif
8631         { }     /* Terminate */
8632 };
8633 
8634 static int cpu_extra_stat_show(struct seq_file *sf,
8635                                struct cgroup_subsys_state *css)
8636 {
8637 #ifdef CONFIG_CFS_BANDWIDTH
8638         {
8639                 struct task_group *tg = css_tg(css);
8640                 struct cfs_bandwidth *cfs_b = &tg->cfs_bandwidth;
8641                 u64 throttled_usec;
8642 
8643                 throttled_usec = cfs_b->throttled_time;
8644                 do_div(throttled_usec, NSEC_PER_USEC);
8645 
8646                 seq_printf(sf, "nr_periods %d\n"
8647                            "nr_throttled %d\n"
8648                            "throttled_usec %llu\n",
8649                            cfs_b->nr_periods, cfs_b->nr_throttled,
8650                            throttled_usec);
8651         }
8652 #endif
8653         return 0;
8654 }
8655 
8656 #ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
8657 static u64 cpu_weight_read_u64(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8658                                struct cftype *cft)
8659 {
8660         struct task_group *tg = css_tg(css);
8661         u64 weight = scale_load_down(tg->shares);
8662 
8663         return DIV_ROUND_CLOSEST_ULL(weight * CGROUP_WEIGHT_DFL, 1024);
8664 }
8665 
8666 static int cpu_weight_write_u64(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8667                                 struct cftype *cft, u64 weight)
8668 {
8669         /*
8670          * cgroup weight knobs should use the common MIN, DFL and MAX
8671          * values which are 1, 100 and 10000 respectively.  While it loses
8672          * a bit of range on both ends, it maps pretty well onto the shares
8673          * value used by scheduler and the round-trip conversions preserve
8674          * the original value over the entire range.
8675          */
8676         if (weight < CGROUP_WEIGHT_MIN || weight > CGROUP_WEIGHT_MAX)
8677                 return -ERANGE;
8678 
8679         weight = DIV_ROUND_CLOSEST_ULL(weight * 1024, CGROUP_WEIGHT_DFL);
8680 
8681         return sched_group_set_shares(css_tg(css), scale_load(weight));
8682 }
8683 
8684 static s64 cpu_weight_nice_read_s64(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8685                                     struct cftype *cft)
8686 {
8687         unsigned long weight = scale_load_down(css_tg(css)->shares);
8688         int last_delta = INT_MAX;
8689         int prio, delta;
8690 
8691         /* find the closest nice value to the current weight */
8692         for (prio = 0; prio < ARRAY_SIZE(sched_prio_to_weight); prio++) {
8693                 delta = abs(sched_prio_to_weight[prio] - weight);
8694                 if (delta >= last_delta)
8695                         break;
8696                 last_delta = delta;
8697         }
8698 
8699         return PRIO_TO_NICE(prio - 1 + MAX_RT_PRIO);
8700 }
8701 
8702 static int cpu_weight_nice_write_s64(struct cgroup_subsys_state *css,
8703                                      struct cftype *cft, s64 nice)
8704 {
8705         unsigned long weight;
8706         int idx;
8707 
8708         if (nice < MIN_NICE || nice > MAX_NICE)
8709                 return -ERANGE;
8710 
8711         idx = NICE_TO_PRIO(nice) - MAX_RT_PRIO;
8712         idx = array_index_nospec(idx, 40);
8713         weight = sched_prio_to_weight[idx];
8714 
8715         return sched_group_set_shares(css_tg(css), scale_load(weight));
8716 }
8717 #endif
8718 
8719 static void __maybe_unused cpu_period_quota_print(struct seq_file *sf,
8720                                                   long period, long quota)
8721 {
8722         if (quota < 0)
8723                 seq_puts(sf, "max");
8724         else
8725                 seq_printf(sf, "%ld", quota);
8726 
8727         seq_printf(sf, " %ld\n", period);
8728 }
8729 
8730 /* caller should put the current value in *@periodp before calling */
8731 static int __maybe_unused cpu_period_quota_parse(char *buf,
8732                                                  u64 *periodp, u64 *quotap)
8733 {
8734         char tok[21];   /* U64_MAX */
8735 
8736         if (sscanf(buf, "%20s %llu", tok, periodp) < 1)
8737                 return -EINVAL;
8738 
8739         *periodp *= NSEC_PER_USEC;
8740 
8741         if (sscanf(tok, "%llu", quotap))
8742                 *quotap *= NSEC_PER_USEC;
8743         else if (!strcmp(tok, "max"))
8744                 *quotap = RUNTIME_INF;
8745         else
8746                 return -EINVAL;
8747 
8748         return 0;
8749 }
8750 
8751 #ifdef CONFIG_CFS_BANDWIDTH
8752 static int cpu_max_show(struct seq_file *sf, void *v)
8753 {
8754         struct task_group *tg = css_tg(seq_css(sf));
8755 
8756         cpu_period_quota_print(sf, tg_get_cfs_period(tg), tg_get_cfs_quota(tg));
8757         return 0;
8758 }
8759 
8760 static ssize_t cpu_max_write(struct kernfs_open_file *of,
8761                              char *buf, size_t nbytes, loff_t off)
8762 {
8763         struct task_group *tg = css_tg(of_css(of));
8764         u64 period = tg_get_cfs_period(tg);
8765         u64 quota;
8766         int ret;
8767 
8768         ret = cpu_period_quota_parse(buf, &period, &quota);
8769         if (!ret)
8770                 ret = tg_set_cfs_bandwidth(tg, period, quota);
8771         return ret ?: nbytes;
8772 }
8773 #endif
8774 
8775 static struct cftype cpu_files[] = {
8776 #ifdef CONFIG_FAIR_GROUP_SCHED
8777         {
8778                 .name = "weight",
8779                 .flags = CFTYPE_NOT_ON_ROOT,
8780                 .read_u64 = cpu_weight_read_u64,
8781                 .write_u64 = cpu_weight_write_u64,
8782         },
8783         {
8784                 .name = "weight.nice",
8785                 .flags = CFTYPE_NOT_ON_ROOT,
8786                 .read_s64 = cpu_weight_nice_read_s64,
8787                 .write_s64 = cpu_weight_nice_write_s64,
8788         },
8789 #endif
8790 #ifdef CONFIG_CFS_BANDWIDTH
8791         {
8792                 .name = "max",
8793                 .flags = CFTYPE_NOT_ON_ROOT,
8794                 .seq_show = cpu_max_show,
8795                 .write = cpu_max_write,
8796         },
8797 #endif
8798 #ifdef CONFIG_UCLAMP_TASK_GROUP
8799         {
8800                 .name = "uclamp.min",
8801                 .flags = CFTYPE_NOT_ON_ROOT,
8802                 .seq_show = cpu_uclamp_min_show,
8803                 .write = cpu_uclamp_min_write,
8804         },
8805         {
8806                 .name = "uclamp.max",
8807                 .flags = CFTYPE_NOT_ON_ROOT,
8808                 .seq_show = cpu_uclamp_max_show,
8809                 .write = cpu_uclamp_max_write,
8810         },
8811         {
8812                 .name = "uclamp.latency_sensitive",
8813                 .flags = CFTYPE_NOT_ON_ROOT,
8814                 .read_u64 = cpu_uclamp_ls_read_u64,
8815                 .write_u64 = cpu_uclamp_ls_write_u64,
8816         },
8817 #endif
8818         { }     /* terminate */
8819 };
8820 
8821 struct cgroup_subsys cpu_cgrp_subsys = {
8822         .css_alloc      = cpu_cgroup_css_alloc,
8823         .css_online     = cpu_cgroup_css_online,
8824         .css_released   = cpu_cgroup_css_released,
8825         .css_free       = cpu_cgroup_css_free,
8826         .css_extra_stat_show = cpu_extra_stat_show,
8827         .fork           = cpu_cgroup_fork,
8828         .can_attach     = cpu_cgroup_can_attach,
8829         .attach         = cpu_cgroup_attach,
8830         .legacy_cftypes = cpu_legacy_files,
8831         .dfl_cftypes    = cpu_files,
8832         .early_init     = true,
8833         .threaded       = true,
8834 };
8835 
8836 #endif  /* CONFIG_CGROUP_SCHED */
8837 
8838 void dump_cpu_task(int cpu)
8839 {
8840         pr_info("Task dump for CPU %d:\n", cpu);
8841         sched_show_task(cpu_curr(cpu));
8842 }
8843 
8844 /*
8845  * Nice levels are multiplicative, with a gentle 10% change for every
8846  * nice level changed. I.e. when a CPU-bound task goes from nice 0 to
8847  * nice 1, it will get ~10% less CPU time than another CPU-bound task
8848  * that remained on nice 0.
8849  *
8850  * The "10% effect" is relative and cumulative: from _any_ nice level,
8851  * if you go up 1 level, it's -10% CPU usage, if you go down 1 level
8852  * it's +10% CPU usage. (to achieve that we use a multiplier of 1.25.
8853  * If a task goes up by ~10% and another task goes down by ~10% then
8854  * the relative distance between them is ~25%.)
8855  */
8856 const int sched_prio_to_weight[40] = {
8857  /* -20 */     88761,     71755,     56483,     46273,     36291,
8858  /* -15 */     29154,     23254,     18705,     14949,     11916,
8859  /* -10 */      9548,      7620,      6100,      4904,      3906,
8860  /*  -5 */      3121,      2501,      1991,      1586,      1277,
8861  /*   0 */      1024,       820,       655,       526,       423,
8862  /*   5 */       335,       272,       215,       172,       137,
8863  /*  10 */       110,        87,        70,        56,        45,
8864  /*  15 */        36,        29,        23,        18,        15,
8865 };
8866 
8867 /*
8868  * Inverse (2^32/x) values of the sched_prio_to_weight[] array, precalculated.
8869  *
8870  * In cases where the weight does not change often, we can use the
8871  * precalculated inverse to speed up arithmetics by turning divisions
8872  * into multiplications:
8873  */
8874 const u32 sched_prio_to_wmult[40] = {
8875  /* -20 */     48388,     59856,     76040,     92818,    118348,
8876  /* -15 */    147320,    184698,    229616,    287308,    360437,
8877  /* -10 */    449829,    563644,    704093,    875809,   1099582,
8878  /*  -5 */   1376151,   1717300,   2157191,   2708050,   3363326,
8879  /*   0 */   4194304,   5237765,   6557202,   8165337,  10153587,
8880  /*   5 */  12820798,  15790321,  19976592,  24970740,  31350126,
8881  /*  10 */  39045157,  49367440,  61356676,  76695844,  95443717,
8882  /*  15 */ 119304647, 148102320, 186737708, 238609294, 286331153,
8883 };
8884 
8885 void call_trace_sched_update_nr_running(struct rq *rq, int count)
8886 {
8887         trace_sched_update_nr_running_tp(rq, count);
8888 }
/* [<][>][^][v][top][bottom][index][help] */
